017package org.microbean.type;
018
019import java.lang.invoke.MethodHandles;
020import java.lang.invoke.MethodHandles.Lookup;
021
022import java.lang.invoke.VarHandle;
023
024import java.lang.reflect.Type;
025
026import java.util.AbstractSet;
027import java.util.Arrays;
028import java.util.Collection;
029import java.util.Collections;
030import java.util.Iterator;
031import java.util.LinkedHashSet;
032import java.util.List;
033import java.util.Objects;
034import java.util.Set;
035import java.util.Spliterator;
036import java.util.Spliterators;
037
038import java.util.function.Predicate;
039
040import java.util.stream.Stream;
041
042import org.microbean.development.annotation.Convenience;
043
044import static java.util.Spliterator.DISTINCT;
045import static java.util.Spliterator.IMMUTABLE;
046import static java.util.Spliterator.NONNULL;
047import static java.util.Spliterator.ORDERED;
048import static java.util.Spliterator.SIZED;
049import static java.util.Spliterator.SUBSIZED;
050
051/**
052 * An immutable {@link AbstractSet} of {@link Type
053 * java.lang.reflect.Type}s that ensures that {@link Type
054 * java.lang.reflect.Type} implementations from different vendors use
055 * the same equality semantics.
056 *
057 * <p><strong>This is not a set of {@link JavaType}
058 * instances.</strong> See the {@link #javaTypeList()} and {@link
059 * #javaTypeSet()} methods.</p>
060 *
061 * @author <a href="https://about.me/lairdnelson"
062 * target="_parent">Laird Nelson</a>
063 *
064 * @see #javaTypeList()
065 *
066 * @see #javaTypeSet()
067 *
068 * @deprecated Now that {@link org.microbean.type.Type} instances can
069 * {@linkplain org.microbean.type.Type#equals(org.microbean.type.Type,
070 * org.microbean.type.Type) can be compared for equality}, there is
071 * not much call for this class.
072 */
073@Deprecated
074public final class JavaTypeSet extends AbstractSet<Type> {
075
076
077  /*
078   * Static fields.
079   */
080
081
082  private static final JavaTypeSet EMPTY_JAVA_TYPE_SET = new JavaTypeSet();
083
084  private static final VarHandle MOST_SPECIALIZED_INTERFACE_TYPE;
085
086  private static final VarHandle MOST_SPECIALIZED_NON_INTERFACE_TYPE;
087
088  static {
089    final Lookup lookup = MethodHandles.lookup();
090    try {
091      MOST_SPECIALIZED_INTERFACE_TYPE = lookup.findVarHandle(JavaTypeSet.class, "mostSpecializedInterfaceType", Type.class);
092      MOST_SPECIALIZED_NON_INTERFACE_TYPE = lookup.findVarHandle(JavaTypeSet.class, "mostSpecializedNonInterfaceType", Type.class);
093    } catch (final NoSuchFieldException | IllegalAccessException reflectiveOperationException) {
094      throw (Error)new ExceptionInInitializerError(reflectiveOperationException.getMessage()).initCause(reflectiveOperationException);
095    }
096  }
097
098
099  /*
100   * Instance fields.
101   */
102
103
104  private final Set<JavaType> set;
105
106  private volatile Type mostSpecializedNonInterfaceType;
107
108  private volatile Type mostSpecializedInterfaceType;
109
110
111  /*
112   * Constructors.
113   */
114
115
116  private JavaTypeSet() {
117    super();
118    this.set = Set.of();
119  }
120
121  private JavaTypeSet(final Type type) {
122    this(JavaType.of(type));
123  }
124
125  private JavaTypeSet(final org.microbean.type.Type<? extends Type> t) {
126    super();
127    this.set = Set.of(t instanceof JavaType jt ? jt : JavaType.of(t.object()));
128  }
129
130  private JavaTypeSet(final Collection<?> types) {
131    super();
132    final int size = types == null || types.isEmpty() ? 0 : types.size();
133    switch (size) {
134    case 0:
135      this.set = Set.of();
136      break;
137    case 1:
138      final Object o = types instanceof List<?> list ? list.get(0) : types.iterator().next();
139      if (o instanceof JavaType jt) {
140        this.set = Set.of(jt);
141      } else if (o instanceof Type t) {
142        this.set = Set.of(JavaType.of(t));
143      } else if (o instanceof org.microbean.type.Type<?> t) {
144        final Object modeledType = t.object();
145        if (modeledType instanceof Type) {
146          this.set = Set.of(JavaType.of((Type)modeledType));
147        } else {
148          this.set = Set.of();
149        }
150      } else {
151        this.set = Set.of();
152      }
153      break;
154    default:
155      final Set<JavaType> set = new LinkedHashSet<>(8); // LinkedHashSet is critical for ordering
156      for (final Object type : types) {
157        if (type instanceof JavaType jt) {
158          set.add(jt);
159        } else if (type instanceof Type t) {
160          set.add(JavaType.of(t));
161        } else if (type instanceof org.microbean.type.Type<?> t) {
162          final Object modeledType = t.object();
163          if (modeledType instanceof Type) {
164            set.add(JavaType.of((Type)modeledType));
165          }
166        }
167      }
168      this.set = Collections.unmodifiableSet(set);
169      break;
170    }
171  }
172
173
174  /*
175   * Instance methods.
176   */
177
178
179  /**
180   * Returns a {@link List} of {@link JavaType}s representing the
181   * elements logically stored by this {@link JavaTypeSet}.
182   *
183   * <p>The returned {@link List} is unmodifiable and does not contain
184   * {@code null} or duplicate elements.  Its iteration order is the
185   * same as that of this {@link JavaTypeSet}.</p>
186   *
187   * @return a {@link List} of {@link JavaType}s representing the
188   * elements logically stored by this {@link JavaTypeSet}
189   *
190   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
191   *
192   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
193   *
194   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
195   * threads.
196   */
197  public final List<JavaType> javaTypeList() {
198    return List.copyOf(this.set);
199  }
200
201  /**
202   * Returns a {@link Set} of {@link JavaType}s representing the
203   * elements logically stored by this {@link JavaTypeSet}.
204   *
205   * <p>The returned {@link Set} is unmodifiable and does not contain
206   * {@code null} elements.  Its iteration order is the same as that
207   * of this {@link JavaTypeSet}.</p>
208   *
209   * @return a {@link Set} of {@link JavaType}s representing the
210   * elements logically stored by this {@link JavaTypeSet}
211   *
212   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
213   *
214   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
215   *
216   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
217   * threads.
218   */
219  public final Set<JavaType> javaTypeSet() {
220    return this.set;
221  }
222
223  /**
224   * Returns a {@linkplain org.microbean.type.Type#customSupertyped()
225   * custom supertyped} {@link JavaType} representing this {@link
226   * JavaTypeSet}.
227   *
228   * @return a {@linkplain org.microbean.type.Type#customSupertyped()
229   * custom supertyped} {@link JavaType} representing this {@link
230   * JavaTypeSet}
231   *
232   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
233   *
234   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
235   *
236   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
237   * threads.
238   *
239   * @see org.microbean.type.Type#customSupertyped()
240   *
241   * @see #javaType(boolean)
242   */
243  public final JavaType javaType() {
244    return this.javaType(false);
245  }
246
247  /**
248   * Returns a {@linkplain org.microbean.type.Type#customSupertyped()
249   * custom supertyped} {@link JavaType} representing this {@link
250   * JavaTypeSet}.
251   *
252   * @param box whether autoboxing is in effect
253   *
254   * @return a {@linkplain org.microbean.type.Type#customSupertyped()
255   * custom supertyped} {@link JavaType} representing this {@link
256   * JavaTypeSet}
257   *
258   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
259   *
260   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
261   *
262   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
263   * threads.
264   *
265   * @see org.microbean.type.Type#customSupertyped()
266   *
267   * @see #javaTypeList()
268   *
269   * @see JavaType#ofExactly(boolean, List)
270   */
271  public final JavaType javaType(final boolean box) {
272    return JavaType.ofExactly(box, this.javaTypeList());
273  }
274
275  /**
276   * Returns a new {@link JavaTypeSet} containing only the {@link
277   * Type}s that are not {@linkplain Class#isInterface() interface
278   * types} from this {@link JavaTypeSet}.
279   *
280   * @return a new {@link JavaTypeSet} containing only the {@link
281   * Type}s that are not {@linkplain Class#isInterface() interface
282   * types} from this {@link JavaTypeSet}
283   *
284   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
285   *
286   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
287   *
288   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
289   * threads.
290   */
291  public final JavaTypeSet nonInterfaceTypes() {
292    return new JavaTypeSet(this.set.stream()
293                           .filter(JavaTypeSet::nonInterfaceType)
294                           .toList());
295  }
296
297  /**
298   * Returns a new {@link JavaTypeSet} containing only the {@linkplain
299   * Class#isInterface() interface types} from this {@link
300   * JavaTypeSet}.
301   *
302   * @return a new {@link JavaTypeSet} containing only the {@linkplain
303   * Class#isInterface() interface types} from this {@link
304   * JavaTypeSet}.
305   *
306   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
307   *
308   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
309   *
310   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
311   * threads.
312   */
313  public final JavaTypeSet interfaceTypes() {
314    return new JavaTypeSet(this.set.stream()
315                           .filter(JavaTypeSet::interfaceType)
316                           .toList());
317  }

428
429  /**
430   * Returns an arbitrarily selected {@link Type} that is guaranteed
431   * to represent the most specialized subclass drawn from the types
432   * in this {@link JavaTypeSet}.
433   *
434   * <p>For example, if a {@link JavaTypeSet} contains {@link
435   * Integer Integer.class}, {@link Number Number.class} and {@link
436   * Object Object.class}, then this method will return {@link Integer
437   * Integer.class}.  If a {@link JavaTypeSet} contains {@link
438   * Integer Integer.class} and {@link String String.class}, then
439   * either {@link Integer Integer.class} or {@link String
440   * String.class} will be returned.</p>
441   *
442   * <p>In practice, most {@link JavaTypeSet}s in normal use
443   * contain classes from a single inheritance hierarchy.</p>
444   *
445   * @return an arbitrarily selected {@link Type} that is guaranteed
446   * to represent the most specialized subclass in its type hierarchy
447   * drawn from the types in this {@link JavaTypeSet}; never {@code
448   * null}; the {@link Type} returned is guaranteed to be either a
449   * {@link Class} or a {@link java.lang.reflect.ParameterizedType}
450   *
451   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
452   *
453   * @idempotency This method is idempotent but deterministic only in
454   * certain cases.
455   *
456   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
457   * threads.
458   *
459   * @see #mostSpecializedInterfaceType()
460   *
461   * @deprecated See {@link
462   * org.microbean.type.Type#mostSpecialized(Predicate)}
463   */
464  @Deprecated
465  public final Type mostSpecializedNonInterfaceType() {
466    Type mostSpecializedNonInterfaceType = this.mostSpecializedNonInterfaceType; // volatile read
467    if (mostSpecializedNonInterfaceType == null) {
468      mostSpecializedNonInterfaceType = this.mostSpecialized(JavaTypeSet::nonInterfaceType);
469      if (!MOST_SPECIALIZED_NON_INTERFACE_TYPE.compareAndSet(this, null, mostSpecializedNonInterfaceType)) { // volatile write
470        return this.mostSpecializedNonInterfaceType; // volatile read
471      }
472    }
473    return mostSpecializedNonInterfaceType == NullType.INSTANCE ? null : mostSpecializedNonInterfaceType;
474  }
475
476  /**
477   * Returns an arbitrarily selected {@link Type} that is guaranteed
478   * to be a {@link Type} representing the most specialized interface
479   * drawn from types representing interfaces in this {@link
480   * JavaTypeSet}, or {@code null} if this {@link JavaTypeSet}
481   * contains no interfaces.
482   *
483   * <p>The {@link Class} that is represented indirectly by the return
484   * value, if any, is guaranteed to return {@code true} from its
485   * {@link Class#isInterface()} method.</p>
486   *
487   * <p>For example, if a {@link JavaTypeSet} {@linkplain
488   * #contains(Type) contains} {@link java.io.Closeable
489   * Closeable.class} and {@link AutoCloseable AutoCloseable.class},
490   * then this method will return {@link java.io.Closeable
491   * Closeable.class}.  If a {@link JavaTypeSet} {@linkplain
492   * #contains(Type) contains} {@link AutoCloseable
493   * AutoCloseable.class} and {@link java.io.Serializable
494   * Serializable.class}, then either {@link AutoCloseable
495   * AutoCloseable.class} or {@link java.io.Serializable
496   * Serializable.class} will be returned.</p>
497   *
498   * @return an arbitrarily selected {@link Type} that is guaranteed
499   * to be a {@link Type} representing the most specialized interface
500   * drawn from types representing interfaces in this {@link
501   * JavaTypeSet}, or {@code null}; the {@link Type} returned is
502   * guaranteed to be either a {@link Class} or a {@link
503   * java.lang.reflect.ParameterizedType}
504   *
505   * @nullability This method may return {@code null}.
506   *
507   * @idempotency This method is idempotent but deterministic only in
508   * certain cases.
509   *
510   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
511   * threads.
512   *
513   * @see #mostSpecializedNonInterfaceType()
514   *
515   * @deprecated See {@link
516   * org.microbean.type.Type#mostSpecialized(Predicate)}
517   */
518  @Deprecated
519  public final Type mostSpecializedInterfaceType() {
520    Type mostSpecializedInterfaceType = this.mostSpecializedInterfaceType; // volatile read
521    if (mostSpecializedInterfaceType == null) {
522      mostSpecializedInterfaceType = this.mostSpecialized(JavaTypeSet::interfaceType);
523      if (!MOST_SPECIALIZED_INTERFACE_TYPE.compareAndSet(this, null, mostSpecializedInterfaceType)) { // volatile write
524        return this.mostSpecializedInterfaceType; // volatile read
525      }
526    }
527    return mostSpecializedInterfaceType == NullType.INSTANCE ? null : mostSpecializedInterfaceType;
528  }
529
530  private final Type mostSpecialized(final Predicate<? super Type> p) {
531    Type candidate = null;
532    for (final JavaType javaType : this.set) {
533      final Type type = javaType.object();
534      if (candidate == null) {
535        if (p.test(type)) {
536          candidate = type;
537        }
538      } else {
539        for (final Type supertype : JavaTypes.supertypes(type)) {
540          if (p.test(supertype) && this.set.contains(JavaType.of(supertype)) && JavaTypes.supertype(candidate, supertype)) {
541            candidate = supertype;
542          }
543        }
544      }
545    }
546    return candidate;
547  }
548
549  @Override // Set<Type>
550  public final boolean contains(final Object o) {
551    return o instanceof Type t ? this.set.contains(JavaType.of(t)) : this.set.contains(o);
552  }
553
554  @Override // Set<Type>
555  public final boolean isEmpty() {
556    return this.set.isEmpty();
557  }
558
559  @Override // Set<Type>
560  public final int size() {
561    return this.set.size();
562  }
563
564  @Override // Set<Type>
565  public final Iterator<Type> iterator() {
566    return this.set.isEmpty() ? Collections.emptyIterator() : new TypeIterator(this.set.iterator());
567  }
568
569  /**
570   * Returns an {@link Iterator} of {@link JavaType} instances
571   * representing the elements stored by this {@link JavaTypeSet}.
572   *
573   * @return an {@link Iterator} of {@link JavaType} instances
574   * representing the elements stored by this {@link JavaTypeSet}
575   *
576   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
577   *
578   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
579   *
580   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
581   * threads.
582   */
583  public final Iterator<JavaType> javaTypeIterator() {
584    return this.set.iterator();
585  }
586
587  @Override // Set<Type>
588  public final Stream<Type> stream() {
589    return this.set.stream().map(JavaType::object);
590  }
591
592  /**
593   * Returns a {@link Stream} of {@link JavaType} instances
594   * representing the elements stored by this {@link JavaTypeSet}.
595   *
596   * @return a {@link Stream} of {@link JavaType} instances
597   * representing the elements stored by this {@link JavaTypeSet}
598   *
599   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
600   *
601   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
602   *
603   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
604   * threads.
605   */
606  public final Stream<JavaType> javaTypeStream() {
607    return this.set.stream();
608  }
609
610  @Override // Set<Type>
611  public final Spliterator<Type> spliterator() {
612    if (this.set.isEmpty()) {
613      return Spliterators.emptySpliterator();
614    } else {
615      return
616        Spliterators.spliterator(this.iterator(),
617                                 this.size(),
618                                 DISTINCT | IMMUTABLE | NONNULL | ORDERED | SIZED | SUBSIZED);
619    }
620  }
621
622  /**
623   * Returns a {@link Spliterator} of {@link JavaType} instances
624   * representing the elements stored by this {@link JavaTypeSet}.
625   *
626   * @return a {@link Spliterator} of {@link JavaType} instances
627   * representing the elements stored by this {@link JavaTypeSet}
628   *
629   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
630   *
631   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
632   *
633   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
634   * threads.
635   */
636  public final Spliterator<JavaType> javaTypeSpliterator() {
637    return this.set.spliterator();
638  }

646  /**
647   * Returns an {@linkplain #isEmpty() empty} {@link JavaTypeSet}.
648   *
649   * @return an {@linkplain #isEmpty() empty} {@link JavaTypeSet}
650   *
651   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
652   *
653   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
654   *
655   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
656   * threads.
657   */
658  @Convenience
659  public static final JavaTypeSet of() {
660    return EMPTY_JAVA_TYPE_SET;
661  }
662
663  /**
664   * Returns a {@link JavaTypeSet} whose sole element models the
665   * supplied {@link Type}.
666   *
667   * @param t the {@link Type} in question; must not be {@code
668   * null}
669   *
670   * @return a {@link JavaTypeSet} whose sole element models the
671   * supplied {@link Type}; never {@code null}
672   *
673   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code t} is {@code null}
674   *
675   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
676   *
677   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
678   *
679   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
680   * threads.
681   *
682   * @see #of(JavaType)
683   *
684   * @see JavaType#of(Type)
685   */
686  @Convenience
687  public static final JavaTypeSet of(final Type t) {
688    return of(JavaType.of(t));
689  }
690
691  /**
692   * Returns a {@link JavaTypeSet} whose elements are modeled by the
693   * supplied {@link Type}s.
694   *
695   * @param t0 one of the {@link Type}s in question; must not be
696   * {@code null}
697   *
698   * @param t1 one of the {@link Type}s in question; must not be
699   * {@code null}
700   *
701   * @return a {@link JavaTypeSet} whose elements are modeled by the
702   * supplied {@link Type}s; never {@code null}
703   *
704   * @exception NullPointerException if any argument is {@code null}
705   *
706   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
707   *
708   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
709   *
710   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
711   * threads.
712   *
713   * @see #of(Collection)
714   *
715   * @see JavaType#of(Type)
716   */
717  @Convenience
718  public static final JavaTypeSet of(final Type t0, final Type t1) {
719    return of(List.of(JavaType.of(t0), JavaType.of(t1)));
720  }
721
722  /**
723   * Returns a {@link JavaTypeSet} whose elements are modeled by the
724   * supplied {@link Type}s.
725   *
726   * @param types the {@link Type}s in question; must not be {@code
727   * null}
728   *
729   * @return a {@link JavaTypeSet} whose elements are modeled by the
730   * supplied {@link Type}s; never {@code null}
731   *
732   * @exception NullPointerException if any argument is {@code null}
733   *
734   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
735   *
736   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
737   *
738   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
739   * threads.
740   *
741   * @see #of(Collection)
742   *
743   * @see JavaType#of(Type)
744   */
745  @Convenience
746  public static final JavaTypeSet of(final Type... types) {
747    if (types.length == 0) {
748      return of();
749    }
750    return of(Arrays.asList(types));
751  }
752
753  /**
754   * Returns a {@link JavaTypeSet} whose sole element is the supplied
755   * {@link org.microbean.type.Type}.
756   *
757   * @param t the {@link org.microbean.type.Type} in question; must
758   * not be {@code null}
759   *
760   * @return a {@link JavaTypeSet} whose sole element is the supplied
761   * {@link JavaType}; never {@code null}
762   *
763   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code t} is {@code null}
764   *
765   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
766   *
767   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
768   *
769   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
770   * threads.
771   */
772  public static final JavaTypeSet of(final org.microbean.type.Type<? extends Type> t) {
773    return new JavaTypeSet(t);
774  }
775
776  /**
777   * Returns a {@link JavaTypeSet} whose elements are the supplied
778   * {@link org.microbean.type.Type}s.
779   *
780   * @param t0 one of the {@link org.microbean.type.Type}s in
781   * question; must not be {@code null}
782   *
783   * @param t1 one of the {@link org.microbean.type.Type}s in
784   * question; must not be {@code null}
785   *
786   * @return a {@link JavaTypeSet} whose elements are modeled by the
787   * supplied {@link org.microbean.type.Type}s; never {@code null}
788   *
789   * @exception NullPointerException if any argument is {@code null}
790   *
791   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
792   *
793   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
794   *
795   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
796   * threads.
797   *
798   * @see #of(Collection)
799   */
800  @Convenience
801  public static final JavaTypeSet of(final org.microbean.type.Type<? extends Type> t0,
802                                     final org.microbean.type.Type<? extends Type> t1) {
803    return of(List.of(t0, t1));
804  }
805
806  /**
807   * Returns a {@link JavaTypeSet} whose elements are modeled by the
808   * supplied {@link org.microbean.type.Type}s.
809   *
810   * @param types the {@link org.microbean.type.Type}s in question;
811   * must not be {@code null}
812   *
813   * @return a {@link JavaTypeSet} whose elements are modeled by the
814   * supplied {@link org.microbean.type.Type}s; never {@code null}
815   *
816   * @exception NullPointerException if any argument is {@code null}
817   *
818   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
819   *
820   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
821   *
822   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
823   * threads.
824   *
825   * @see #of(Collection)
826   */
827  @Convenience
828  @SafeVarargs
829  @SuppressWarnings("varargs")
830  public static final JavaTypeSet of(final org.microbean.type.Type<? extends Type>... types) {
831    if (types.length == 0) {
832      return of();
833    }
834    return of(Arrays.asList(types));
835  }
836
837  /**
838   * Returns a {@link JavaTypeSet} whose elements are drawn from the
839   * supplied {@link Collection}, in its {@linkplain
840   * Collection#iterator() iteration order}.
841   *
842   * @param types the {@link Collection} in question; must not be
843   * {@code null}; only its elements that are instances of either
844   * {@link Type} or {@link JavaType} or {@link
845   * org.microbean.type.Type org.microbean.type.Type&lt;? extends
846   * Type&gt;} will be considered
847   *
848   * @return a {@link JavaTypeSet} whose elements are drawn from the
849   * supplied {@link Collection}, in its {@linkplain
850   * Collection#iterator() iteration order}; never {@code null}
851   *
852   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code types} is {@code null}
853   *
854   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
855   *
856   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
857   *
858   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
859   * threads.
860   */
861  public static final JavaTypeSet of(final Collection<?> types) {
862    return new JavaTypeSet(types);
863  }
864
865  /**
866   * Returns a {@link JavaTypeSet} whose elements are the {@linkplain
867   * JavaTypes#supertypes(Type) supertypes} of the {@link Type}
868   * modeled by the supplied {@link org.microbean.type.Type} (which
869   * include the modeled {@link Type} itself).
870   *
871   * @param t the {@link org.microbean.type.Type} in question; must
872   * not be {@code null}
873   *
874   * @return a {@link JavaTypeSet} whose elements are the {@linkplain
875   * JavaTypes#supertypes(Type) supertypes} of the {@link Type}
876   * modeled by the supplied {@link org.microbean.type.Type} (which
877   * include the modeled {@link Type} itself); never {@code null}
878   *
879   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code t} is {@code null}
880   *
881   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
882   *
883   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
884   *
885   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
886   * threads.
887   *
888   * @see #ofSupertypes(org.microbean.type.Type, Predicate)
889   */
890  @Convenience
891  public static final JavaTypeSet ofSupertypes(final org.microbean.type.Type<? extends Type> t) {
892    return ofSupertypes(t.object(), JavaTypes::acceptAll);
893  }
894
895  /**
896   * Returns a {@link JavaTypeSet} whose elements are the {@linkplain
897   * JavaTypes#supertypes(Type) supertypes} of the {@link Type}
898   * modeled by the supplied {@link org.microbean.type.Type} (which
899   * include the modeled {@link Type} itself).
900   *
901   * @param t the {@link org.microbean.type.Type} in question; must
902   * not be {@code null}
903   *
904   * @param acceptancePredicate a {@link Predicate} controlling
905   * membership of a {@link Type} in the returned {@link JavaTypeSet};
906   * must not be {@code null}
907   *
908   * @return a {@link JavaTypeSet} whose elements are the {@linkplain
909   * JavaTypes#supertypes(Type) supertypes} of the {@link Type}
910   * modeled by the supplied {@link org.microbean.type.Type} (which
911   * include the modeled {@link Type} itself); never {@code null}
912   *
913   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code t} is {@code null}
914   *
915   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
916   *
917   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
918   *
919   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
920   * threads.
921   *
922   * @see #ofSupertypes(org.microbean.type.Type, Predicate)
923   */
924  @Convenience
925  public static final JavaTypeSet ofSupertypes(final org.microbean.type.Type<? extends Type> t,
926                                               final Predicate<? super Type> acceptancePredicate) {
927    return ofSupertypes(t.object(), acceptancePredicate);
928  }
929
930  /**
931   * Returns a {@link JavaTypeSet} whose elements are the {@linkplain
932   * JavaTypes#supertypes(Type) supertypes of the supplied
933   * <code>Type</code>} (which include the supplied {@link Type}
934   * itself).
935   *
936   * @param t the {@link Type} in question; must not be {@code null}
937   *
938   * @return a {@link JavaTypeSet} whose elements are the {@linkplain
939   * JavaTypes#supertypes(Type) supertypes of the supplied
940   * <code>Type</code>} (which include the supplied {@link Type}
941   * itself)
942   *
943   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code t} is {@code null}
944   *
945   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
946   *
947   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
948   *
949   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
950   * threads.
951   *
952   * @see #ofSupertypes(Type, Predicate)
953   */
954  @Convenience
955  public static final JavaTypeSet ofSupertypes(final Type t) {
956    return ofSupertypes(t, JavaTypes::acceptAll);
957  }
958
959  /**
960   * Returns a {@link JavaTypeSet} whose elements are the {@linkplain
961   * JavaTypes#supertypes(Type) supertypes of the supplied
962   * <code>Type</code>} (which include the supplied {@link Type}
963   * itself), gated by the supplied {@link Predicate}.
964   *
965   * @param t the {@link Type} in question; must not be {@code null}
966   *
967   * @param acceptancePredicate a {@link Predicate} controlling
968   * membership of a {@link Type} in the returned {@link Collection};
969   * must not be {@code null}
970   *
971   * @return a {@link JavaTypeSet} whose elements are the {@linkplain
972   * JavaTypes#supertypes(Type) supertypes of the supplied
973   * <code>Type</code>} (which include the supplied {@link Type}
974   * itself)
975   *
976   * @exception NullPointerException if either {@code t} or {@code
977   * acceptancePredicate} is {@code null}
978   *
979   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
980   *
981   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
982   *
983   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
984   * threads.
985   *
986   * @see #of(Collection)
987   *
988   * @see JavaTypes#supertypes(Type)
989   */
990  @Convenience
991  public static final JavaTypeSet ofSupertypes(final Type t, final Predicate<? super Type> acceptancePredicate) {
992    return of(JavaTypes.supertypes(t, acceptancePredicate));
993  }
994
995  private static final boolean nonInterfaceType(final JavaType t) {
996    return nonInterfaceType(t.type());
997  }
998
999  private static final boolean nonInterfaceType(final Type t) {
1000    final Class<?> c = JavaTypes.erase(t);
1001    return c != null && !c.isInterface();
1002  }
1003
1004  private static final boolean interfaceType(final JavaType t) {
1005    return interfaceType(t.type());
1006  }
1007
1008  private static final boolean interfaceType(final Type t) {
1009    final Class<?> c = JavaTypes.erase(t);
1010    return c != null && c.isInterface();
1011  }
1012
1013
1014  /*
1015   * Inner and nested classes.
1016   */
1017
1018
1019  private static final class TypeIterator implements Iterator<Type> {
1020
1021    private final Iterator<? extends JavaType> i;
1022
1023    private TypeIterator(final Iterator<? extends JavaType> i) {
1024      super();
1025      this.i = Objects.requireNonNull(i, "i");
1026    }
1027
1028    @Override // Iterator<Type>
1029    public final boolean hasNext() {
1030      return this.i.hasNext();
1031    }
1032
1033    @Override // Iterator<Type>
1034    public final Type next() {
1035      return this.i.next().object();
1036    }
1037
1038    @Override // Iterator<Type>
1039    public final void remove() {
1040      this.i.remove();
1041    }
1042
1043  }
1044
1045
1046  private static final class NullType implements Type {
1047
1048    private static final Type INSTANCE = new NullType();
1049
1050    private NullType() {
1051      super();
1052    }
1053
1054  }
1055
1056}
